alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 4:22PM PDT until September 13 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Inyo County in south central California... * Until 630 PM PDT. * At 422 PM PDT, Local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Doppler radar estimates between 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported US-395 is closed near mile marker 38 due to water and debris over the highway. SR-190 is closed at the junction of SR-136 due to water over the roadway. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Olancha and Cartago. This includes portions of US- 395 between mile markers 34 to 45 as well as SR- 190 between Olancha to SR- FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
